page.title: 08Grey seals (cont'd).
page.content:
Pupping takes place between September and November on quiet, isolated beaches.At birth they are about one metre long and weigh 15 kilograms.Over the next three weeks, on a diet of high-fat milk, their weight trebles. During this time, the mother has not eaten at all and as soon as the pup reaches this size she goes off to eat and leaves the pup to fend for itself - it can swim by this time.
{CONSERVATION}A seal's natural enemies are killer whales and man. There are not many whales in the area, and seal pups are protected by law (the Seal Conservation Act of 1970) from 1 Sept to 31 Dec. The pups are hunted for their white fur, which lasts for two weeks after birth.On Lundy the seals are safe. {Michael Hearfield }
